00013 #ifndef VIRTUALDIR_H_
00014 #define VIRTUALDIR_H_
00015 
00016 #include <fuse.h>
00017 
00018 #include "db_backend.hpp"
00019 
00020 class VirtualDirectory{
00021 private:
00022         DbBackend * db;
00023         
00024 public:
00025         VirtualDirectory(const char *path);
00026         
00027         ~VirtualDirectory();
00028         
00029         /*
00030          * Start the database associated with this virtual directory
00031          */
00032         int init() { return db->db_init_storage(); }
00033         
00034         /*
00035          * Checks if the query is valid. This means that all the tags from the
00036          * query exist in the DB. We also set the flags value to indicate that we have
00037          * a real path and/or tags.
00038          * The return value is negative if one of the specified tags doesn't exist.
00039          */
00040         int vdir_validate(const char *path, int *flags);
00041         
00042         /*
00043          * Adds file info coresponding to this file, to the db.
00044          */
00045         int vdir_add_tag(vector <string> *tags, file_info_t *finfo);
00046         
00047         /*
00048          * List root directory. This is special, because it lists all the tags from the db.
00049          */
00050         int vdir_list_root(void *buf, fuse_fill_dir_t filler);
00051         
00052         /*
00053          * readdir for a virtual directory
00054          */
00055         int vdir_readdir(const char * query, void *buf, fuse_fill_dir_t filler);
00056         
00057         /*
00058          * replaces the tag-value components provided by the 'oldq' query with the ones
00059          * provided by the 'newq' query.
00060          */
00061         int vdir_replace(const char * oldq, const char *newq);
00062         
00063 };
00064 
00065 #endif /*VIRTUALDIR_H_*/
